data.title: Athens Plus
data.text: Athens + Plus Weekly newspaper published by The International Herald Tribune & Kathimerini SA • No 22 • Friday, November 7, 2008 • €2 A novel idea Ring my bell Actor-director Angelita Tsougou talks about staging Sylvia Plath’s “Bell Jar” and her plans to perform it in English. Page 28 Green shoots Panathinaikos win Henk ten Cate’s team shakes things up after a stunning 3-0 victory over Bremen in Germany. Page 18 Oh, James! Bond is back Daniel Craig stars in “Quantum of Solace,” which is showing around Greece this week. Page 35 Locals fight to save Exarchia neighborhood Rise in drug-related crime prompts demands for better policing of central Athens district Residents of the central Athens district of Exarchia have launched a public campaign to reclaim their streets after complaining that the area has become plagued with drug addicts and petty crime. Locals, who recently held a protest to highlight their concerns, have told Athens Plus that residents are coming together to protect what they regard as the neighborhood’s distinctive character but say that the police are not doing enough. Officers reject these claims, insisting that that there are regular patrols. Pages 2, 4-5 [AFP] OA suitors cleared for final approach NEWERA Young Democrats in Athens show their joy as the results of Tuesday’s US presidential elections are announced, revealing Barack Obama as the country’s first African-American president. Attention is now turning to what an Obama presidency would mean for Greece and the rest of the world. Pages 6, 7, 11 & 13 The government is due to announce in January the names of the successful bidders aiming to take over parts of Olympic Airlines, Transport Minister Costis Hatzidakis announced on Thursday. Hatzidakis said that the interested parties would submit non-binding offers in December after a government committee approved the bids submitted by 13 companies interested in taking over Olympic’s flight operations, ground handling and technical maintenance. Among those participating in the process are Qatar Airways, Spanish airline Iberia, as well as several Greek companies. Page 8 Greece has potential to tackle climate change Greece has the ability to make a significant contribution to efforts to deal with climate change, provided some basic steps are underpinned by the necessary political will, the environmental group WWF said this week. In a report made public on Wednesday, WWF said that Greece could cut its carbon emissions by up to 67 percent by 2050 with no negative impact on economic growth. The group also believes that demand for electricity can be significantly reduced, while the amount of power generated from renewable energy sources can be increased. Page 15 Olive oil Liquid gold It’s harvest time in the country’s olive groves again – learn about the benefits of the queen of all oils and why organic is best. Page 33 4 5 DeJohnette Jazz legend Joined by South Africa’s Sibongile Khumalo and an international cast of emerging artists, a drumming legend arrives for two shows. Page 31 Picking up Momentum More than 10,000 people are set to test their levels of endurance on Sunday, as the Athens Classic Marathon seeks to build on its heritage and become one of the world’s top longdistance races. Pages 24-25 Rethymnon Open book Its streets and buildings, its arts and its achievements in the letters tell the long colorful tale of this Cretan city. Page 42 9 771791 550005 Glitz bits Greek and foreign designers to showcase their collections in the capital starting Saturday Page 23
